Dataset Name: Afri Code Datasets (A collection of datasets for code generation in African languages)
Use Cases: Training and evaluating Large Language Models (LLMs) for code generation, building AI-powered coding assistants that understand African languages, research in low-resource NLP, improving developer productivity for non-English speakers.
Challenges/Notes: This is a collection, not a single dataset, so users must navigate to individual datasets for use. The primary challenge it addresses is the extreme scarcity of parallel code-text data for low-resource African languages. The quality, size, and language coverage may vary significantly between the individual datasets in the collection.

Language-specific: Bemba has no prior large-scale digital resources

Train AI models for schizophrenia detection using EEG biomarkers in African populations

- Benchmark EEG-based computational psychiatry models across ancestries
Challenges/Notes:
Small sample size relative to global EEG datasets (153 subjects)
- Limited demographic diversity within Nigeria (e.g., ethnic, linguistic, socioeconomic)
- No fMRI, structural MRI, or clinical scale scores (e.g., PANSS) mentioned
- No publicly available link or access protocol yet confirmed

Use Cases:
Detect smallholder farm presence in data-scarce, conflict-affected, or remote regions
- Improve accuracy of cropland mapping beyond traditional land cover products (e.g., ESA CCI, MODIS)
- Enable timely food security assessments and early warning systems
- Support humanitarian aid targeting and agricultural policy design
Challenges/Notes:
Geographically limited to two Ethiopian regions (Tigray & Amhara)
- No temporal series — snapshot from 2020–2023, not annual
- No crop-type classification — only binary farm/non-farm
- Low-resolution imagery (PlanetScope) may miss very small or obscured fields
- Requires geospatial and ML expertise to process and interpret

- No distinction between crop types (e.g., maize, cassava)
- May misclassify irrigated or fallow land as cropland
